Talk_4000:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting_00>Yes, yes, what is it?<sp:0:4:0>Oh, it's you, Link. Haven't seen you in—<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseL_01>LINK! YOU'RE BACK?!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><sp:0:2:2:6400>Ah— <sp:5:1:0>My apologies for the outburst.
C-clearly, you're back in town, then.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>But what of Princess Zelda?
Talk_1009:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_01>Speaking of <clr:0000>detailed images<clr:ffff>...<sp:0:4:0><clr:0000>Robbie<clr:ffff> mentioned he was making a tool
to make pictures out of scenery.<sp:0:4:0>I wonder if he ever finished it.<sp:0:4:0>Maybe I'll try asking him once he's back
from <clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>.
Talk_3034:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_01>With the new vegetables being developed,
they're harvesting less rice these days.
That's a shame, as it's a favorite of mine.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>You should taste it for yourself, Link!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Speaking of rice, our next subject is home
economics. <sp:5:0:0>I planned to use the occasion to
talk up dishes that use Hylian rice...<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_4001:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:TalkPositive_01>Yes, yes, what is it?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>Ah! Eager for the next <clr:0000>history<clr:ffff> class to
begin, I take it?<sp:0:4:0>The subject is <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>, which I'm not
surprised you have a keen interest in.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>But you're a little early for class to start.
Would you mind waiting?
Talk_2010:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Notice_00>How can I show the children something
that would help them understand?
Talk_3035:
<sp:3:0:2:0501>Hmm. <sp:5:0:0>It doesn't seem that you have room
for anything else.<sp:0:4:0>I love the Hylian rice grown in this village,
so I'd thought it might be nice to give
you some.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>But it'll keep. Please do come and see me
again once you've made space for it.
Talk_4002:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Think_00>Are you that excited to hear me lecture on
<clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>? <sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>Well, I appreciate that, but it's a bit early
for class to begin. <sp:5:0:0>Wait just a little longer,
if you can.
Talk_3036:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:SurpriseM_00>Link! <sp:5:0:0>Ready to receive your reward,
I take it? Here you are.
Talk_3037:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:SurpriseM_00>Link! <sp:5:0:0>Ready to receive your reward,
I take it?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0401>Oh...still overloaded as ever, I see.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>Well, the Hylian rice will keep. But do
come see me again once you've made
space for your reward.
Talk_4004:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Today's lesson concerns Hyrule's history
alongside <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>!<sp:0:4:0>To study history is to learn from those
who came before us.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>A thorough understanding of the past is
essential if our children hope to build
a better future.<sp:0:4:0>You're welcome to sit in on the class and
observe, if you like!<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_3038:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Sad_01>Errr...but never mind that. <sp:5:0:0>I have another
class later, and you're free to observe
that one, too, if you like.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>And with that, I should get back to
the lesson.
Talk_4005:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Sad_00>Just what road led to Hyrule becoming
the place that it is today?<sp:0:4:0>I believe that in order for our children to
have a bright future, they must first learn
about <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>I'd be pleased if you joined us for today's
lesson, Link.<sp:5:0:0>
Talk_3039:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Work_01>Oh, pardon me. <sp:5:0:0>I got wrapped up in my
own thoughts about class again.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>If you have time for it, you're welcome to
observe the next lesson as well. I think it
would make the children happy.
Talk_4023:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting>Class is from morning until noon-ish,
so please stop by the <clr:0000>classroom on the
first floor<clr:ffff>.
Talk_4024:
<sp:3:0:2:0001>If you have the time for it, Link, why don't
you sit in on one of our lessons?<sp:0:4:0>We start class promptly each morning
once all the children are settled in.
Talk_2016:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>I can see I'll have to actually show the
class the <clr:0000>screen depicting the Calamity<clr:ffff>
to move my lesson plan forward...
Talk_4025:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_00>Ah, Princess Zelda is still missing, which
is the reason you came here alone... That
makes more sense.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Princess Zelda built this <clr:0000>school<clr:ffff>, you see.<sp:0:4:0>She cared so much about the children.
I'm sure this would be one of her first
stops if she had returned.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>Right now, we're covering history, which
was very important to Princess Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>We're focusing on Hyrule's history
alongside <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>You know, Link, you're welcome to sit in
on a lesson if you'd like.
Talk_2017:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_01>What should I do?<sp:0:4:0>If I had more foresight, I'd have borrowed
the Screen of the Ancient Hero from
Lady Impa's Hall.<sp:0:4:0><clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0501>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>, where the hall is located,
is also in Necluda, but it's too far to the
<clr:0000>northwest <clr:ffff>for a casual visit.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>If only I could show these children <clr:0000>a<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>detailed image <clr:ffff>of the screen depicting
the Calamity, I think they'd understand.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Although I suppose it isn't Lady Impa's Hall now,
is it? More accurate to call it Lady Paya's Hall.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_4026:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>That said, class has ended for today. But I
hope to see you here tomorrow morning!
Talk_4009:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>My, my, aren't we early. You're certainly
welcome to sit in on my <clr:0000>class<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>The subject of today's lesson is Hyrule's
history alongside <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>It'll begin shortly after I get settled.
Talk_2018:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Angry_00>Ah, yes, so, our subject today is history
once again. <sp:5:0:0>First, let's go over what we
learned the other day.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>The story of Hyrule is deeply intertwined
with the Calamity. <sp:5:0:0>And that is no
exaggeration or embellishment.<sp:0:4:0>The Calamity has been visited upon the
land of Hyrule several times before.<sp:0:4:0>It was sealed away 10,000 years ago by
the sacred princess and a hero wielding
the sword that seals the darkness.
Talk_2019: <sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Angry_00>Mr. Symin! Can you prove any of this?!
0004: I have a picture to show.
Talk_2039:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Angry_00>So, ah, for this class we'll be going over
the Calamity again. Let's start by
reviewing our last lesson.
Talk_3020:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Thank you so much, Link.<sp:0:4:0>My lecture about <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff> might run
long, but I hope you'll stay for it anyway.
Talk_3021: <sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Work_01>Tell us more! When did all this happen?
Talk_3040:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>The Divine Beasts were taken over by the
Calamity. Those selected to pilot them
lost their lives in the process.<sp:0:4:0>Worse still, the hero wielding the sword
that seals the darkness was badly hurt.
Just when all seemed lost...<sp:0:4:0>The sacred princess came into her power
and devoted her whole being to keeping
the Calamity at bay for 100 years.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Is everyone following along so far?
Talk_3041:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>After spending 100 years dormant, the
hero wielding the sword that seals the
darkness awakened, his wounds healed.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>He won back the Divine Beasts with the
help of several allies, including some of
the Champions' descendants.<sp:0:4:0>And in the end, the hero defeated the
Calamity, and the sacred princess stopped
the evil one!
Talk_3042:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Tired_00>Sorry, I got a little emotional there at the
end. <sp:5:0:0>It's a true story though.
Talk_2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, good evening to you. <sp:5:0:0>You needn't
worry about me lying here.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0301>The problem of figuring out how to explain
<clr:0000>the Calamity of 10,000 years ago<clr:ffff> to the
children has been keeping me awake.
Talk_3009: <sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:Happy_01>So the legend was true? That's amazing!
Talk_3026:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Sad_00>Sadly, the sacred princess was unable to
awaken the holy power within her.
Talk_4010:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>I wonder if a class on the Calamity might
have been too difficult for the children.<sp:0:4:0>But to study history is to learn at the feet
of those who came before us.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>A thorough understanding of the past is
essential if our children hope to build
a better future!<sp:0:4:0>I must be patient and teach them until
they've learned the lesson well.
Talk_3027:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:SurpriseS_00>That's too bad, but there's no sense
fretting over it.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>Today marks the last day of history class, 
but if you have any questions about the
<clr:0000>Calamity<clr:ffff>, I'm always happy to discuss it.<sp:0:4:0>Feel free to contact me anytime outside
of class.
Talk_2020:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Greeting_00>Isn't it more likely that over time, history
and legend started to blur together?
Talk_3028:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_01>Oh, that's right... <sp:5:0:0>You should have
something for all your help. Would
this do?
Talk_2004:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>I wish that I could show the children a
<clr:0000>detailed image <clr:ffff>of the screen depicting
the Calamity found in Kakariko Village.<sp:0:4:0>I think they'd understand in no time if
they had a visual aid like that.
Talk_2021:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Think>Are we still talking about stuff that
happened 10,000 years ago?
Talk_3029:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Greeting_00>All that we have...our land, our lives,
our civilization... We owe it to all those
who fought for it through the centuries.
Talk_2022:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting_01>Can you point to any paintings or images
that actually show there was a <clr:0000>Calamity
10,000 years ago<clr:ffff>?
Talk_4015:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Sad_00>"History is a tale we all tell together. It
was begun by those who came before us,
and those who follow us will continue it."<sp:0:4:0>So said Princess Zelda when asked why
she founded this school.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>I want the children to make it in this
perilous world and build a bright future.<sp:0:4:0>That's why I put so much effort into
teaching them about history...especially
about <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>But teaching is learning, you know, so I
keep up my own studies every day to
make sure I'm up to the task.
Talk_2041:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>A <clr:0000>picture <clr:ffff>of it would do the trick.
Anything to show the children what the
screen depicting the Calamity looks like.
Talk_2024:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Think_01>There must be some way I can help the
children understand...
Talk_2008:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>Ah, Link. Good morning to you.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>The problem of figuring out how to get my
lesson across to the children has been
keeping me awake.
Talk_2042:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Ease_01>Without that, I don't see how I can move
forward with my lesson plan.
Talk_2025:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>Ah, hello, Link.<sp:0:4:0>If it's all right with you, I'd like your help
in researching <clr:0000>the Calamity<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01>Right now, my stumbling block is figuring
out how to help the children understand
the lesson I'm teaching.
Talk_2044:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_01>The problem of figuring out how to explain
<clr:0000>the Calamity of 10,000 years ago<clr:ffff> to the
children has been keeping me awake.
Talk_4019:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_00>I plan to make <clr:0000>Hyrule's struggle with the
Calamity <clr:ffff>the focus of the class.<sp:0:4:0>To study history is to learn from those
who came before us.<sp:0:4:0>A thorough understanding of the past is
essential if our children hope to build
a better future.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>I need to be patient and walk them
through whatever difficulties they might
be encountering.
Talk_1000:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Greeting_01>Today's class will be a history lesson.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0001>The story of Hyrule is deeply intertwined
with the Calamity. <sp:5:0:0>And that is no
exaggeration or embellishment.<sp:0:4:0>The Calamity has been visited upon the
land of Hyrule several times before.<sp:0:4:0>It was sealed away 10,000 years ago by
the sacred princess and a hero wielding
the sword that seals the darkness.
Talk_3010:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseM_00>What's this?! A screen depicting the
Calamity! <sp:5:0:0>C-class, please take note here.<sp:0:4:0>This is a rare opportunity to see a primary
source regarding the Calamity!
Talk_3011:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>You know...<sp:5:0:0>seeing this makes it feel like
it might've happened yesterday.
Talk_1004:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think>Over time, history and legend sometimes
blur together.
Talk_3012:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>Well, if you got documented proof,
that's good enough for me!<sp:0:4:0>Go on, Mr. Symin! Tell us the rest of the
story about the Calamity!
Talk_1005:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_00>All this stuff about 10,000 years ago and
such...who cares?
Talk_3030:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:TalkPositive_00>Wow. I wanna be like the ancient hero and
give the next generation good lives too!
Talk_1006:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_00>You got any pictures or proof to back up
this so-called <clr:0000>10,000-year-old Calamity<clr:ffff>?
Talk_3031: <sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Ease_01>Ahhh. That went splendidly.<sp:0:4:0>Words cannot convey my satisfaction.
Talk_1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:Work_01>It's no fairy tale, I assure you. These are
real historical events!<sp:5:1:0><sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>This is a problem... I'll need to show them some
kind of depiction of the Calamity from 10,000
years ago.<sp:0:4:0>Otherwise this lesson is over before it began.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Think_00>I'm sorry, Link. <sp:5:0:0>This isn't how I thought
the lesson would go.<sp:0:4:0>If I had more foresight, I'd have borrowed
the screen depicting the Calamity from
Lady Impa's Hall.<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0><clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>, where the hall is located,
is also in Necluda, but it's too far to the
<clr:0000>northwest <clr:ffff>for a casual visit.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>If only I could show these children <clr:0000>a
detailed image <clr:ffff>of the screen depicting
the Calamity, I think they'd understand.<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0c01>Although I suppose it isn't Lady Impa's Hall now,
is it? More accurate to call it Lady Paya's Hall.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk_3033:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>And I couldn't have done it without you
showing us the screen, Link. Once again,
thank you so much for your assistance.
